page.title: 11TRANSPORT IN SALPERTON AREA
page.content: The nearest railway stations are at Cheltenham (6 miles) and Kingham (14 miles).There are no bus services connecting with trains.Most people living in the area have to walk up to a mile to reach the nearest bus route in order to get to Cheltenham for work or shopping.The bus services are privately owned but subsidised. Most households own private cars.In Salperton only two elderly pensioners have no car and they depend on friends for lifts into Cheltenham.The nearest petrol pump is 6 miles away. There are special school buses which take children to the primary school in Andoversford,secondary schools in Cheltenham, and Westwoods Grammar School in Northleach.
